definition.description: Bartleby's Core: The base of any ManagedModel

_id.description: The object unique Identifier is named _id to gains native support in MongoDB - you can use UID as accessor

externalVersionNumber.description: An external Version number (sometimes a timestamp) that can be used to define if the object as changed (e.g: used in App layer synchronization feeds)

creatorUID.description: Collectible protocol: The Creator UID - Can be used for ACL purposes automatically injected in new entities Factories

items.description: The UIDS of the free relations
The UIDS of the owned entities (Neither supervised nor serialized check appendToDeferredOwnershipsList for explanations)

summary.description: A human readable model summary. If you want to disclose more information you can adopt the Descriptible protocol.

ephemeral.description: An instance Marked ephemeral will be destroyed server side on next ephemeral cleaning procedure.This flag allows for example to remove entities that have been for example created by unit-tests.

_quietChanges.description: //Internal flag used not to propagate changes (for example during deserialization) -> Check ManagedModel + ProvisionChanges for detailled explanantions

_autoCommitIsEnabled.description: //Auto commit availability -> Check ManagedModel + ProvisionChanges for detailed explanantions

commitCounter.description: The internal commit provisioning counter to discriminate Creation from Update and for possible frequency analysis
